intro: Polygala hospita var. achtarovii, commonly known as the Achtarovii milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
